page.title: 02Landscape of Woolaston
page.content: Landscape of the Woolaston block. The block of land surveyed by Wyedean School is bounded in the North by the main road from Chepstow to St.Briavels, and the River Severn to the S.E. The block is on a S.E.facing slope which falls steeply to the floodplain of the Severn. The land use is mostly forestry and farming with scattered cottages and farms. Strict planning control has concentrated all new housing into the main village of Woolaston/Netherend. In the past 20 years all new housing,private and council has been built here, doubling the village's size, making a big social impact on the old villagers. The new villagers have come from all over Britain.
